metadata.feature_description: Configure whether content requires approval before publication for Answers, Discussions, Ideas, and Social Events modules.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify default values (all true) for new installations

steps.action: Navigate to Admin > Settings > Community Settings
steps.expected: Content Moderation section visible with all four checkboxes (Answers, Discussions, Ideas, Social Events) checked by default
steps.actual: Content Moderation section displayed with all four checkboxes checked: Answers (checked), Discussions (checked), Ideas (checked), Social Events (checked)

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Enable content moderation for Answers module

steps.action: Verify Answers checkbox is initially checked (enabled)
steps.expected: Answers checkbox should be checked by default
steps.actual: Answers checkbox was checked (content moderation enabled)

steps.expected: Answers checkbox should be checked again

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Disable content moderation for Answers module

steps.action: Click on Answers checkbox to uncheck it
steps.actual: Answers checkbox was successfully unchecked (content moderation disabled)

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Enable content moderation for Discussions module

steps.action: Verify Discussions checkbox is initially checked, then re-enable after disabling

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Disable content moderation for Discussions module

steps.action: Click on Discussions checkbox to uncheck it

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Enable content moderation for Ideas module
Disable content moderation for Ideas module

steps.action: Click on Ideas checkbox to uncheck it

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Enable content moderation for Social Events module

steps.action: Re-enable Social Events checkbox after disabling
steps.expected: Social Events checkbox should be checked

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Disable content moderation for Social Events module

steps.action: Click on Social Events checkbox to uncheck it
steps.expected: Social Events checkbox should become unchecked
steps.actual: Social Events checkbox was successfully unchecked

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Save all moderation settings and verify persistence

steps.action: Disable Answers checkbox and click Save button
steps.expected: Settings should be saved with success message
steps.actual: Save button clicked and 'Item successfully saved.' message appeared

steps.action: Refresh page and navigate back to Community Settings
steps.actual: After page refresh, Answers checkbox was found to be checked again. The setting did not persist as expected.

issues: Settings persistence issue: After saving with Answers disabled and refreshing the page, the Answers checkbox reverted to checked state. The save operation showed success message but the setting did not persist to the database.

observations: The UI for Content Moderation Settings is functional and all toggle operations work correctly in the current session.
The save operation displays a success notification but there appears to be an issue with settings persistence across page refreshes.
All four Content Moderation checkboxes (Answers, Discussions, Ideas, Social Events) are properly labeled and interactive.
The default state for all moderation settings is enabled (checked), which matches the documented default values.
The Community Settings panel is accessible via Settings > Community in the PersonaBar.
Potential issue with CmxSettingsController.SaveCmxSettings() method - save returns success but changes may not be persisting to the database.
